Sentencas: Fuel cells utilizing thin electrolyte films deposited onto a prefabricated anode support using spray pyrolysis were tested.
Titulo: Solid oxide fuel cells with electrolytes prepared via spray pyrolysis

Sentencas: Spray pyrolysis allows to prepare thin electrolytes with low ohmic losses and thereby to reduce the operating temperature of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) while maintaining high power output.
Titulo: Solid oxide fuel cells with electrolytes prepared via spray pyrolysis

Sentencas: The electrolyte films consisted of a layer of 8 mol% yuria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) and a layer of ceria 10 mol% yttria solid solution (CYO).
Titulo: Solid oxide fuel cells with electrolytes prepared via spray pyrolysis

Sentencas: Both were deposited by spray pyrolysis onto NiO-YSZ self-supporting anode substrates.
Titulo: Solid oxide fuel cells with electrolytes prepared via spray pyrolysis

Sentencas: The cells were operated using hydrogen as fuel and air as oxidant at temperatures of 600-800degreesC and exhibited an open circuit voltage of 1.01 V at 720degreesC indicating a dense and crack-free electrolyte film.
Titulo: Solid oxide fuel cells with electrolytes prepared via spray pyrolysis

Sentencas: High power density in excess of 750 mW/cm(2) was provided by cells with a 600 run thin YSZ/CYO bilayer electrolyte at 770degreesC. Cells containing the bilayer electrolytes were operated for over 450 h at 720degreesC with tolerable degradation.
Titulo: Solid oxide fuel cells with electrolytes prepared via spray pyrolysis

Sentencas: Good performances of cells with more than two layers of different electrolytes were achieved at 700degreesC but considerable degradation was observed.
Titulo: Solid oxide fuel cells with electrolytes prepared via spray pyrolysis

Sentencas: Spray parameters such as deposition temperature showed an effect on cell performance.
Titulo: Solid oxide fuel cells with electrolytes prepared via spray pyrolysis
